course_description: An exploration of these two complex categories too often taken for granted, using basic questions and issues about one to force basic questions and issues about the other. Basic questions and issues will pertain to the nature of modern North Atlantic world formations and their developments, types of representations; social functions; practices and performances; the exercises of power; and so forth. The aim is to facilitate critical and constructive thinking and conversation about compelling modern psycho-social and discursive formations and politics.
schedule_location: T 2:30pm-5:30pm in Rita Anne Rollins Building_549
